title: CSU Sentinel Sites for Nature
text: A consortium of California State University campuses have established monitoring sites as part of the California Biodiversity Sentinel Site Network.

title: CSU SSN Members, Associated Researchers, and Students
text:
Associate Professor, Biological Sciences
 
My goal is to train students to be excellent field biologists with strong quantitative skills. I usually work on mammals, mostly in California, using a combination of publicly available data, data collected in the field, and remote sensing techniques. I strongly believe we should learn to use, and develop, cutting edge techniques while remaining rooted in a strong tradition of natural history.

Frost Teacher-Scholar Postdoctoral Fellow

title: CSU SSN Members, Associated Researchers, and Students
text:
Graduate Students





Gregory Grimsby
Masters Student
 
Gregory received his bachelor‚Äôs degree in Wildlife and Fisheries Biology from the University of Michigan in 2019 where he first began exploring the role of spatial ecology in wildlife management and conservation. He then spent 3 years working with the endangered New Mexico Meadow Jumping Mouse (Zapus luteus) in southern New Mexico.
In Tim Bean‚Äôs lab at Cal Poly, Gregory‚Äôs research is part of a larger project looking into range shifts and habitat suitability for California small mammal species. Specifically, he is investigating changes in the extent of species‚Äô range using the latest data from the Sentinel Site Network, and assessing range-wide habitat suitability for each species. In the future, Gregory is interested in exploring new ways to better understand the distribution of species in the environment.

title: CSU SSN Monitoring Stations
text:
CSU Biodiversity Monitoring Stations
MAP OF SITES


Core Sites
Each core sentinel site includes small and large terrestrial animal monitoring using wildlife cameras, acoustic monitoring of birds and bats, and phenology monitoring using time lapse cameras. (Green circles on map)


Extended Sites
Extended sites include all the monitoring programs as core sites, plus a motus tag tracking tower and an internet-connected weather station. (Orange circles on map)
